definition: Paulson or Powellson (name)/Henry (Hank) Paulson (1946-), US banker, US Treasury Secretary from 2006
Bulgaria/Bulgarian/abbr. for 保加利亞|保加利亚[Bao3 jia1 li4 ya4]
to defend/to protect/to keep/to guarantee/to ensure/civil administration unit in the baojia 保甲[bao3 jia3] system (old)

sentences.english: But Mr. Paulson insists that he wants a “clean” plan.
sentences.chinese: 但是保爾森先生堅持他想要一個“乾淨”的方案。

sentences.english: Going into the weekend, Paulson made a three-part gamble.
sentences.chinese: 到週末時，保爾森進行了一個由三部分組成的賭博。

sentences.english: These were the investments Paulson wanted included in a new DDO.
sentences.chinese: 保爾森希望把這些投資納入一款新DDO。

sentences.english: The Treasury secretary says he hopes for congressional approval next week.
sentences.chinese: 保爾森說，他希望下星期能獲得國會的批准。

sentences.english: Paulson supports the principle-based approach, to a degree.
sentences.chinese: 在某種程度上，保爾森支持採用原則性監管體制。

sentences.english: Both Bush and Paulson were visibly reluctant to be taking this step.
sentences.chinese: 很明顯，布什和保爾森都不想這樣做。

sentences.english: Paulson & Co. , did not receive any accusation.
sentences.chinese: 保爾森對沖基金公司並未受到指控。
